description.narrative: Los hogares y las comunidades de los distritos seleccionados promueven prÃ¡cticas favorables para los niÃ±os a fin de mejorar la supervivencia, el desarrollo y la protecciÃ³n inclusivos y equitativos de las niÃ±as, los niÃ±os y los adolescentes., which contributes to Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Operations Support To Programme Delivery, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Innovation, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Para 2023, los niÃ±os y niÃ±as, especialmente los mÃ¡s desfavorecidos y vulnerables, tienen un acceso mejor y mÃ¡s equitativo a los servicios sociales bÃ¡sicos (salud, VIH, nutriciÃ³n, Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH), educaciÃ³n y desarrollo de la primera infancia), y hacen uso de ellos, tambiÃ©n en situaciones de emergencia.

title.narrative: Los hogares y las comunidades de los distritos seleccionados promueven practicas favorables para los ni?os a fin de mejorar lasupervivencia, el desarrollo y la proteccion inclusivos y equitativos de las ni?as, los ni?os y los adolescentes.

description.narrative: In 2021 the CO prioritized its response to two major emergencies in the country: the COVID-19 pandemic and its effects on the children and adolescents and the explosions in the City of Bata. It also faced several obstacles to keep promoting an integrated and decentralized model for child-focused service delivery through the Child-Friendly Districts Initiative, including the lack of funding, competing priorities, and travel restrictions imposed by the government to prevent the spread of COVID-19, that impeded UNICEF staff to have a more significant presence in the field.;;; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/01/2022
